revised_title: Shear Waves and the Earth's Core: A Reevaluation of the Liquid Core Hypothesis
tldr: The author examines the travel-time data of longitudinal and transverse waves observed during earthquakes to study the Earth's core. They discuss the possibility of a rigid core based on the discovery of shear waves transmitted through the core, contradicting the widely accepted liquid core hypothesis. The author presents new evidence from a New Zealand earthquake, which supports the existence of a rigid core.
